snippet: Chun Yin, a street vendor, became the family breadwinner after her husband had a stroke, but she was not allowed to sell under his city-issued license.
abstract: Canal Street vendor Chun Yin receives vending license bearing her name and photo, after more than decade of seeking to transfer her husband's license to her name; there are only 853 licenses available to nonveterans; 7,230 summonses were issued in 2013 for unlicensed vendors.

byline.contributor: Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Chun Yin, a street vendor, became the family breadwinner after her husband had a stroke, but she was not allowed to sell under his city-issued license.

headline.main: Selling Baubles on the Street: License Required
headline.print_headline: Selling Baubles on the Street: License Required
